snippet: The United States is urgently warning the Iraqi government to prepare its people for the dam’s failure, fearing up to 500,000 could be killed if repairs don’t come in time.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: The United States is urgently warning the Iraqi government to prepare its people for the dam’s failure, fearing up to 500,000 could be killed if repairs don’t come in time.
abstract: State Dept officials warn that insufficient maintenance of Mosul Dam in Iraq could lead either to partial or total collapse, over 16 months after Iraqi and Kurdish forces reclaimed it from Islamic State group; United States officials have urged Iraqi authorities to warn civilians of possibility of collapse as they fear repairs will not be made in time for spring, when Tigris River is swollen by melting snow and rain.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

headline.print_headline: Neglect May Do What ISIS Didn’t: Breach Dam
headline.main: Neglect May Do What ISIS Didn’t: Breach Iraqi Dam
